item.description:
The Goethe-Institut Boston and the Coolidge Corner Theatre are pleased to present four new films from Germany highlighting four young directors who, with their first or second features demonstrate that there is more to New German Cinema than The Lives of Others. Four Sunday Matinees showcase a sampling of new and award-winning German films rarely shown outside Europe.

All films in German with English subtitles and shown in Moviehouse 2.

Ticket Price: All $5


The Other Boy (Der Andere Junge)

Two perfectly normal families live in a suburb of Hamburg. The fathers have been friends for years and work for the same company. However, the parents are unaware of the brutal and despairing animosity raging between their adolescent sons. Paul, the bully, goads his victim, the introverted Robert, to fatal violence: he shoots his tormentor. The parents cover up the crime and this family thriller takes an even more desperate and drastic turn to tragedy.

dir. Volker Einrauch, 1h35m, 35 mm
